page.title: 18Cricket in Leverton
page.content: Leverton Cricket Club was formed some seven years ago by several interested village cricketers who used to play for other village teams.They decided that it was time the village had its own team.A local farmer was approached and permission obtained to create a cricket field in the middle of what is known locally as the park.Since then the cricket club has continued to play friendly fixtures both home and away against other local village teams.The players enjoy their cricket even when they lose.The ground itself is a typical village cricket ground and is a beautiful place in which to play. The outfield contains a large walnut tree and if hit by a batsman during the course of his innings scores five runs.In the history of all matches played at home it has been hit only three times in seven years.
